channel.title: üè¢ Purdue University on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Purdue University on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: A Theory of Optimistically Universal Online Learnability for General Concept Classes
item.description: This paper fully characterizes concept classes optimistically universally learnable online, introducing novel algorithms and revealing equivalences between agnostic and realizable settings.

item.title: A Unified Debiasing Approach for Vision-Language Models across Modalities and Tasks
item.description: SFID, a novel debiasing method, effectively mitigates bias in vision-language models across various tasks without retraining, improving fairness and efficiency.

item.title: BiScope: AI-generated Text Detection by Checking Memorization of Preceding Tokens
item.description: BISCOPE: AI-generated text detection using a novel bidirectional method that outperforms existing techniques by leveraging both prediction and memorization of preceding tokens.

item.title: Conditional Generative Models are Sufficient to Sample from Any Causal Effect Estimand
item.description: ID-GEN: Sample high-dimensional interventional distributions using any conditional generative model!

item.title: Counterfactual Fairness by Combining Factual and Counterfactual Predictions
item.description: This paper proposes a novel method to achieve optimal counterfactual fairness in machine learning models while minimizing predictive performance degradation.

item.title: Curvature Clues: Decoding Deep Learning Privacy with Input Loss Curvature
item.description: Deep learning privacy is enhanced by a new membership inference attack using input loss curvature, exceeding existing methods, especially on large datasets.

item.title: DiGRAF: Diffeomorphic Graph-Adaptive Activation Function
item.description: DIGRAF, a novel graph-adaptive activation function, significantly boosts Graph Neural Network performance by dynamically adapting to graph structure, offering consistent superior results across divers…

item.title: ECLipsE: Efficient Compositional Lipschitz Constant Estimation for Deep Neural Networks
item.description: ECLipsE: A novel compositional approach drastically accelerates Lipschitz constant estimation for deep neural networks, achieving speedups of thousands of times compared to the state-of-the-art while …

item.title: Efficient Policy Evaluation Across Multiple Different Experimental Datasets
item.description: This paper presents novel graphical criteria and estimators for accurately evaluating policy effectiveness across multiple experimental datasets, even when data distributions differ.

item.title: Estimating Ego-Body Pose from Doubly Sparse Egocentric Video Data
item.description: DSPoser: A novel two-stage approach accurately estimates full-body pose from doubly sparse egocentric video data using masked autoencoders for temporal completion and conditional diffusion models for …

item.title: FIARSE: Model-Heterogeneous Federated Learning via Importance-Aware Submodel Extraction
item.description: FIARSE dynamically optimizes submodels in federated learning based on parameter importance, improving efficiency and global model accuracy.

item.title: Gradient-based Discrete Sampling with Automatic Cyclical Scheduling
item.description: ACS: Automatic Cyclical Scheduling revolutionizes gradient-based discrete sampling by intelligently switching between exploration and exploitation phases to efficiently navigate complex multimodal dis…

item.title: Great Minds Think Alike: The Universal Convergence Trend of Input Salience
item.description: Deep neural networks surprisingly exhibit universal convergence in input salience, aligning more closely as model capacity increases, revealing valuable insights into model behavior and improving deep…

item.title: Hierarchical Federated Learning with Multi-Timescale Gradient Correction
item.description: MTGC tackles multi-timescale model drift in hierarchical federated learning.

item.title: Improved Sample Complexity for Multiclass PAC Learning
item.description: This paper significantly improves our understanding of multiclass PAC learning by reducing the sample complexity gap and proposing two novel approaches to fully resolve the optimal sample complexity.

item.title: Learning from Snapshots of Discrete and Continuous Data Streams
item.description: This paper presents novel theoretical frameworks and algorithms for learning from snapshots of discrete and continuous data streams, resolving key learnability challenges in online learning under cont…

item.title: Learning General Parameterized Policies for Infinite Horizon Average Reward Constrained MDPs via Primal-Dual Policy Gradient Algorithm
item.description: First-ever sublinear regret & constraint violation bounds achieved for infinite horizon average reward CMDPs with general policy parametrization using a novel primal-dual policy gradient algorithm.

item.title: LeDex: Training LLMs to Better Self-Debug and Explain Code
item.description: LEDEX: A novel training framework significantly boosts LLMs’ code self-debugging by using automated data collection, supervised fine-tuning, and reinforcement learning, leading to more accurate code a…

item.title: LLMDFA: Analyzing Dataflow in Code with Large Language Models
item.description: LLMDFA: A novel LLM-powered framework performs compilation-free and customizable dataflow analysis, achieving high accuracy in bug detection by decomposing the task into sub-problems and mitigating L…

item.title: Multiclass Transductive Online Learning
item.description: Unbounded label spaces conquered! New algorithm achieves optimal mistake bounds in multiclass transductive online learning.

item.title: OPEL: Optimal Transport Guided ProcedurE Learning
item.description: OPEL: a novel optimal transport framework for procedure learning, significantly outperforms SOTA methods by aligning similar video frames and relaxing strict temporal assumptions.

item.title: Partial Structure Discovery is Sufficient for No-regret Learning in Causal Bandits
item.description: Learning optimal interventions in causal bandits with unknown causal graphs is now efficient; this paper identifies the minimal causal knowledge needed and offers a two-stage algorithm with sublinear …

item.title: Sample Efficient Bayesian Learning of Causal Graphs from Interventions
item.description: Efficiently learn causal graphs from limited interventions using a novel Bayesian algorithm that outperforms existing methods and requires fewer experiments.

item.title: Soft Superpixel Neighborhood Attention
item.description: Soft Superpixel Neighborhood Attention (SNA) optimally denoises images by incorporating superpixel probabilities into an attention module, outperforming traditional methods.

item.title: Source Code Foundation Models are Transferable Binary Analysis Knowledge Bases
item.description: ProRec, a novel framework, bridges the binary-source semantic gap by using a binary-source encoder-decoder model and LLMs, achieving significant improvements in zero-shot binary summarization and func…

item.title: Unified Covariate Adjustment for Causal Inference
item.description: Unified Covariate Adjustment (UCA) offers a scalable, doubly robust estimator for a wide array of causal estimands beyond standard methods.

item.title: Universal Rates for Active Learning
item.description: Active learning’s optimal rates are completely characterized, resolving an open problem and providing new algorithms achieving exponential and sublinear rates depending on combinatorial complexity mea…

item.title: Utilizing Human Behavior Modeling to Manipulate Explanations in AI-Assisted Decision Making: The Good, the Bad, and the Scary
item.description: AI explanations can be subtly manipulated to influence human decisions, highlighting the urgent need for more robust and ethical AI explanation design.

item.title: When LLM Meets DRL: Advancing Jailbreaking Efficiency via DRL-guided Search
item.description: RLbreaker uses deep reinforcement learning to efficiently create highly effective jailbreaking prompts, outperforming existing methods against multiple state-of-the-art LLMs and defenses.
